classData.comment:
/**
 * The base class for (almost) all classes inside the Neo namespace
 * Exceptions are e.g. core.IdGenerator, vdom.VNode
 * @class Neo.core.Base
 */
classData.description: The base class for (almost) all classes inside the Neo namespace Exceptions are e.g. core.IdGenerator, vdom.VNode
classData.name: Base

classData.description: You can define methods which should get delayed. Types are buffer, debounce & throttle.
classData.name: delayable

classData.comment:
/**
         * While it is recommended to change the static delayable configs on class level,
         * you can change it on instance level too. If not null, we will do a deep merge.
         * @member {Object} delayable=null
         */

classData.comment:
/**
     * Triggered after the id config got changed.
     * You can dynamically change instance ids if needed. They need to stay unique at any given point.
     * Use case: e.g. component based lists, where you want to re-use item instances.
     * @param {String|null} value
     * @param {String|null} oldValue
     * @protected
     */
classData.description: Triggered after the id config got changed. You can dynamically change instance ids if needed. They need to stay unique at any given point. Use case: e.g. component based lists, where you want to re-use item instances.
classData.name: afterSetId

classData.description: Adjusts all methods inside static delayable
classData.name: applyDelayable

classData.comment:
/**
     * Applying overwrites and adding overwrittenMethods to the class constructors
     * @param {Object} cfg
     * @protected
     */
classData.description: Applying overwrites and adding overwrittenMethods to the class constructors
classData.name: applyOverwrites

classData.comment:
/**
     * Convenience method for beforeSet functions which test if a given value is inside a static array
     * @param {String|Number} value
     * @param {String|Number} oldValue
     * @param {String} name config name
     * @param {Array|String} [staticName=name + 's'] name of the static config array
     * @returns {String|Number} value or oldValue
     */
classData.description: Convenience method for beforeSet functions which test if a given value is inside a static array
classData.name: beforeSetEnumValue

classData.comment:
/**
     * From within an overwrite, a method can call a parent method, by using callOverwritten.
     *
     * @example
     *    afterSetHeight(value, oldValue) {
     *        // do the standard
     *        this.callOverwritten(...arguments);
     *        // do you own stuff
     *    }
     *
     * We create an error to get the caller.name and then run that method on the constructor.
     * This is based on the following error structure, e.g. afterSetHeight.
     *
     *     Error
     *         at Base.callOverwritten (Base.mjs:176:21)
     *         at Base.afterSetHeight (Overrides.mjs:19:26)
     *
     * @param args
     */
classData.description: From within an overwrite, a method can call a parent method, by using callOverwritten.
classData.name: callOverwritten

classData.comment:
/**
     * Uses the IdGenerator to create an id if a static one is not explicitly set.
     * Registers the instance to manager.Instance if this one is already created,
     * otherwise stores it inside a tmp map.
     * @param {String} id
     */
classData.description: Uses the IdGenerator to create an id if a static one is not explicitly set. Registers the instance to manager.Instance if this one is already created, otherwise stores it inside a tmp map.
classData.name: createId

classData.name: destroy

classData.comment:
/**
     * We want to assign class fields first and remove them from the config object,
     * so that afterSet(), beforeGet() and beforeSet() methods can get the new values right away
     * @param {Object} config
     * @returns {Object}
     * @protected
     */
classData.description: We want to assign class fields first and remove them from the config object, so that afterSet(), beforeGet() and beforeSet() methods can get the new values right away
classData.name: setFields

classData.description: Stores timeoutIds internally, so that destroy() can clear them if needed
classData.name: timeout

classData.description:
Enhancing the toString() method, e.g.

`Neo.create('Neo.button.Base').toString() => "[object Neo.button.Base (neo-button-1)]"`
classData.name: toStringTag

classData.comment:
/** *

Enhancing the instanceof method. Without this change:

* `Neo.collection.Base.prototype instanceof Neo.core.Base => true` *

With this change:

* `Neo.collection.Base.prototype instanceof Neo.core.Base => false`
* `Neo.create(Neo.collection.Base) instanceof Neo.core.Base => true` * @returns {Boolean} */
classData.description:
Enhancing the instanceof method. Without this change:

`Neo.collection.Base.prototype instanceof Neo.core.Base => true`

With this change:

`Neo.collection.Base.prototype instanceof Neo.core.Base => false`
`Neo.create(Neo.collection.Base) instanceof Neo.core.Base => true`
classData.name: hasInstance
